alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason; Menard; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kimble, southeastern Menard, western Mason and southeastern Sutton Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 318 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hext to near Junction to Us- 377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line to 10 miles south of Us- 277 Near The Sutton- Edwards County Line. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Junction, Mason, Menard, Yates Crossing, Saline, Streeter, Camp Air, Grit, Katemcy, Roosevelt, Telegraph, Segovia, Long Mountain, London, Hext, South Llano River State Park, Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, Cleo and Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 436 and 477. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
